Writing Gosu rules

0701221

Lesson
objectives

¢ Explain the role of Gosu rules in ClaimCenter
¢ Write effective Gosu rules to meet business
needs

Introducing Gosu rules

| Gosu rules G

¢ Gosu rules are part of the Guidewire Platform capabilities
« Written in Gosu (an open-source programming language)
¢ ClaimCenter Gosu rules execute business logic required for claims processing

Data User

Model Interface
Integ.
APIs

Guidewire Platform
provides a common technology for configuring...

Data User Integration
Model Interface APIs

| Rule Sets

¢ Gosu rules are organized into
rule sets

« Rule sets are categorized by the
event type that triggers the
event-specific rules

* These are rule set categories

¢ Rule sets contain Gosu rules:

#) ActivityEscalationRules.grs

Iv Activity Escalation Rules
Gosu Rule: | [Y] AERO1000 - High priority activities

[¥] AERO2000 - Urgent priority activities

Y Be Rule Sets

* Child rules are only processed if their parent rule’s Condition evaluates as True

| Triggering Events

¢ The base ClaimCenter configuration
includes Gosu Rules triggered by
seventeen distinct types of events

« In this lesson we discuss Exception rules
and Preupdate rules

rules and Validation rules

+ Aninstance of gw.rules.Action, WhiCh iS Gamma SSS Sr rr rarer rere
used for functions such as exiting rules
or rulesets in a useful way

| Exception rules G

Exception rules define actions taken if an object is in a specified state.
* An activity is escalated
* An object either:
+ Has had significant activity since the last time the exception rules were run, or

+ Has had no significant activity for a long time (defined by the 1dleclaimrhresholdDays parameter)

| Activity escalation rules G

¢ Specify what actions to take when an ra
+ ad

activity is escalated

¢ Batch process activityesc runs

every 30 minutes (by default) #2) ActivityEscalationRules grs
ae . Il I
* Detects activities where the Escalation Date ars 9) AEROIO0O- High priority activities
is in the past, but the Activity has not yet [¥] AERO2000 - Urgent priority activities

been escalated
« Escalates these activities

¢ ClaimCenter then runs escalation rules
for the activities that have been
escalated

| Claim exception rules G

* Specify what actions to take if a claim is as Shay
* Recently updated
¢ Not updated for too long a period €) ClaimExceptionRules.grs
* Batch process claimexception sea By cern ta SIU Life Cycle State

looks for recently updated claims R030

* Runs daily at (by default) 2 am M CERO5000 - BizRules

* Batch process idleclaimexception looks for claims untouched for (by default)
7 days

* Runs (by default) Sundays at noon

* Both processes add claims to the ClaimException table

| Group exception rules

¢ Look for groups that “need attention”
and perform appropriate action on
them
¢ Batch process groupexception runs
(by default) every day at 4am
¢ Identifies groups that
+ Have been changed

+ Have not been inspected for a (definable)
period of time

« Runs Group Exception rules against these
groups

te
rm) a@n

#) GroupExceptionRules.grs
3 — Group Exception Rules

| User exception rules

¢ Look for users that “need attention”
and perform appropriate actions on
them

¢ Batch process userexception runs
(by default) every day at 3 am
* Identifies users that have been changed

¢ Runs User Exception rules against these
users

ii—2

®) UserExceptionRules.grs
f — User Exception Rules

Configuring exception rules

original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

| Preupdate rules G

« Fire whenever an object (of certain types) is ready for VE Preupdate

submission to the database seers

« Perform domain logic or processing that must be completed before 4) ExposurePreupdate

the object is committed €) GroupPreupdate
. €) MatterPreupdate

5, #) RlAgreementPreupdate
° When saving a contact = 4) RiTransactionsetPreupdate
(trigger), 4) subrogationPreupdate
a #) TransactionSetPreupdate

changed (condition), contact. PrinaryAddress.isFieldchanged("Addresstinel") oF
* Then change the address on contace-reinerfnadeese.isFielacenged(caity") et
any checks scheduled for this contact. Prinryaddrens-iaFielachanged{-resecieoas")) and
contact (action) Perey an ees aes aa

new gw. financials. CheckUpdater (gw.transaction.Transaction.getCurrent ()) -updateMailingAddress (contact)

Question G

_— — What is the parent of a rule set called?

4
¢
7

- SS H SSs e e

Answer Gi

_— — What is the parent of a rule set called?

¢
¢ 6
; The correct answer is a rule set category.

~-SS HS S s e H

Question G

,— — Which component of a Gosu rule determines whether the rule will be

Y executed?
4

- SS H SSs e e

Answer Gi

,~ — Which component of a Gosu rule determines whether the rule will be
Y executed?
7
The correct answer is the Condition, which must evaluate to true or false. If it
evaluates to true, the rule is executed.

~-SS HS S s e H

Question G

,— — What triggers exception rules?

4
¢
7

- SS H SSs e e

Answer Gi

,— — What triggers exception rules?

¢
¢
¢ The correct answer is when an object is in a specified state, such as an activity being

escalated.

~-SS HS S s e H

Question G

_— — What triggers preupdate rules?

4
¢
7

- SS H SSs e e

Answer Gi

_— — What triggers preupdate rules?

¢
g The correct answer is when an attempt is made to update an entity, that is, to save it to
the database.
